tp.pr2

Class Instruction

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr2.Instruction

  • public class Instruction
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the information parsed from the input. It represents an instruction that can be interpreted by the robot. An instruction encapsulates an Action and possibly a Rotation (if the action is TURN) and/or an identifiers (if the action needs an item)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Instruction()
      Default constructor.
      Instruction(Action action)
      Creates an instruction only with the action (the rotation is UNKNOWN) The identifier is the empty string
      Instruction(Action action, Rotation rotation)
      Creates an instruction with the action and the rotation parameter.
      Instruction(Action action, java.lang.String id)
      Creates an instruction with the action and the identifier for the instruction.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Action getAction()
      Gets the action defined by the instruction
      java.lang.String getId()
      Gets the item identifier stored in the instruction
      Rotation getRotation()
      Gets the rotation stored in the instruction
      boolean isValid()
      Checks if the instruction is a valid instruction

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Instruction

        public Instruction()
        Default constructor. It creates an UNKNOWN action and rotation. By default, the identifier is the empty string

      • Instruction

        public Instruction(Action action)
        Creates an instruction only with the action (the rotation is UNKNOWN) The identifier is the empty string
        Parameters:
        action - Action Instruction

      • Instruction

        public Instruction(Action action,
           Rotation rotation)
        Creates an instruction with the action and the rotation parameter. The identifier is the empty string
        Parameters:
        action - Action instruction
        rotation - Direction of the rotation

      • Instruction

        public Instruction(Action action,
           java.lang.String id)
        Creates an instruction with the action and the identifier for the instruction. It corresponds to instructions OPERATE, SCAN and PICK. The rotation is UNKNOWN
        Parameters:
        action - Action instruction
        id - Identifier for the instruction

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks if the instruction is a valid instruction
        Returns:
        false if the action is UNKNOWN, the action is TURN but the rotation is UNKNOWN or if an item identifier is mandatory for the given action but it does not contain an item identifier. Return true otherwise

      • getAction

        public Action getAction()
        Gets the action defined by the instruction
        Returns:
        The value of the action associated to the instruction

      • getRotation

        public Rotation getRotation()
        Gets the rotation stored in the instruction
        Returns:
        The value of the rotation associated to the instruction

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Gets the item identifier stored in the instruction
        Returns:
        The identifier of the instruction associated to the instruction
